summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing the probate of Jeffrey Epstein's estate following his death. The emails reveal that Epstein's attorneys, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, are the executors, that Epstein updated his will and established a trust (the "1953 Trust") the day before his death, and that the assets flow to unnamed trustees of that trust. The correspondents express outrage and note the apparent contradiction between the attorneys questioning the suicide ruling and Epstein's estate planning just prior to death.

events.title: Epstein Updates Will and Establishes Trust
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein updated his will and reorganized the structure of his assets, including establishing the "1953 Trust" (1953 being his birth year).

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died. The medical examiner concluded the death was by suicide, a conclusion his attorneys later questioned.

events.title: Probate Petition Filed
events.description: A Petition to Probate the Epstein Estate and Will was filed in the Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein updated his will and established a new trust (the '1953 Trust') on August 8, 2019, the day before his death.
Epstein's two main lawyers, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, who handle his business activities, are named as the executors of his estate.
The ultimate beneficiaries of Epstein's assets are the unnamed 'acting Trustees of the 1953 Trust,' keeping the recipients confidential.

The email chain highlights the perceived contradiction between Epstein's attorneys publicly questioning the suicide ruling and their knowledge of his extensive estate planning immediately prior to his death.
The probate petition for Epstein's estate was filed in the Virgin Islands on August 15, 2019.
